revised_title: Penicillin Inactivation Mechanism and Development of Resistance
tldr: This article discusses the inactivation mechanism of penicillin by β-lactamase enzymes and the development of bacterial resistance to antibiotics. The authors study the E. coli β-lactamase enzyme and its inactivation by mechanism-based reagents. They also explore the importance of understanding the enzyme's mechanism to develop new antibiotics and inactivators to combat bacterial resistance.
